website_summaries.verdict: While the Wink Hub has some design and usability kinks to work out, its affordability and versatility make it a very desirable option for whole-home automation.
pros: Wink's $80 hub works with a lot of different protocols and brands and costs less than the competition
cons: Pairing products with the hub can be complicated and the app isn't as accessible as some of its partners' standalone designs

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you place this about 20-35 feet from WiFi routers. I was having problems with is disconnecting constantly until I moved further away. Wink support was top notch when I needed them. Love the responsiveness of the newer firmware/ software. Turning lights on and off are now near instant, about a half second delay now. It is compatible with a bunch of home automation which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Dad

customer_reviews.title: Wink App is great companion setup is really easy
customer_reviews.text: Wink App is great companion setup is really easy. Wink customer service is just a click away. They are very freindly. App is getting better ever update, still some issues on my note 3 but nothing that makes it unusable. I bought the hub + GE Link Bulk bulb set and have been buying one or two additional switches or sensors a paycheck. 90-days in and I have everything i care about automated ! Cons: app still has "quirks" NO web interface! With NEST i can connect to nest via any browser. Wink requires the app to function.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Great device to tie together all of your IoT devices
customer_reviews.text: The Wink Hub has done a great job of connecting all the different IoT items in my home. I have about 9 different apps for all the different devices and this funnels them into one. The setup is consistent on all devices that you attach but can be a little clunky sometimes. The additional items that Wink offers like lightbulbs and door switches are much cheaper than going to other systems after you purchase the hub. These devices can then function robots similar to IFTTT to trigger events which is downright awesome.
customer_reviews.author: jhelms54

customer_reviews.title: Wink Management is retroactively increasing the price of this device
customer_reviews.text: On May 10, 2020, Wink management sent me an email stating that I would now have to pay $60/yr ($5/mo) to use their hub, which, when I bought it, stated that there would be "no required monthly fees, ever". They initially gave me three days to pay this extortion fee. In my view, this company is circling the drain, and this extortion attempt is a way to get some money in the door. I wouldn't touch this device with a ten foot pole now. I have transitions to a Samsung SmartThings hub, which has no monthly fee.
customer_reviews.author: Yo Mama

customer_reviews.title: Getting better.
customer_reviews.text: Just like so many other low-star reviews here, I too had all but lost faith in relying on the Wink system of home automation for pretty much anything. But after reading about a security update, needing to send my hub back in to be reconfigured and sent back (all free) this device works smoothly. The app on the phone runs smoother and things connect to everything faster. Still relies on my wifi being up all the time, and products are still somewhat limited compared to other systems. Almost home.
customer_reviews.author: DPENN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I wish I could control the lights I have connected to my LiftMaster hub. The only thing I can control from the LiftMaster hub is the garage, which I'm okay with. I am using it to control the Nest thermostat, the garage, two smoke detectors, a Kwikset lock, and three GE Link bulbs. I like being able to have the lights on a schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Garcia-Jurado

customer_reviews.title: ... too many connection issues and it's response time is horrible when compared to others
customer_reviews.text: This thing has far too many connection issues and it's response time is horrible when compared to others. My Hue lights do just fine and this thing lags in comparison. Once they added Nest I was excited- sadly it takes 5 login failures and then it just randomly shows up without every actually saying it was set up correctly. I would give it fewer stars but personally this thing was tossed in with my other purchases. If they worked the bugs out the system I think it could be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob G. Beach

customer_reviews.title: Poor system with no updated or support
customer_reviews.text: Wink is no longer usable without a subscription, meaning none of its devices will work either. System crashes and there are no updates to correct known issues (drains the battery of smart locks for example). I cannot recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Jen

customer_reviews.title: Smart Home Hub You Can Set Up Yourself
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy device and with it I have been able to turn my house into a Smart Home. The downside is that it's not extremely easy to set up with various different brands of plugs and cameras. It also has gone offline and has to be re-started to be reset from time to time. As a result, I have had to set up a wifi enabled plug so I can re-start the hub remotely, when it requires it.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne M

customer_reviews.title: REALLY disappointed to learn (after spending over an hour on hold ...
customer_reviews.text: REALLY disappointed to learn (after spending over an hour on hold waiting for support rep) that Wink has a special, contractual agreement with Philips to omit several key features of the Wink platform when it comes to Philips Hue bulbs. The ONLY thing that the Wink platform is authorized to do is turn INDIVIDUAL lights on/off, change color, dim setting. NO grouping, NO robots, NO shortcuts. And according to the support rep with whom I spoke, there is no plan to change this. Wink Relay and Hub going right back to Amazon! So terribly disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: DeltaX-Dev

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bait and Switch. Now I get to wait for pennies back on the dollar in 24-36mos. after some lawyers finish them off in a Class Action suit.
customer_reviews.author: dilsnik

customer_reviews.title: Connect your HOME!
customer_reviews.text: Best and cheapest way to sync your connected products ... I own a Nest thermostat and smoke detector Link Bulbs and a few other little quirky and wemo devices its a one stop app to see everything going on I only expect the line of products that it works with to grow and grow
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The Wink worked out of the box and connecting to the network was no problem. On the Wink site Leviton is one of the compatible suppliers. But not all Z-wave items are currently up and running. I have numerous 4 button scene controllers and these will not work with the Wink hub. Customer service was nice and did follow up but the modification to include the controller is a future project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My heart belongs to wink
customer_reviews.text: This product is the base of my smart home system. Since buying I have installed 26 smart bulbs, 3 cameras, 3 smart locks, an alarm system, an eggminder several smart remotes, some on/off switches, and a piggy bank.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Newton

customer_reviews.title: Not reccomended at all, buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Wink Hub, only to be told after repeated setup failures that it has to be to returned to the factory for a firmware upgrade before it can work. This Hub could never work 'out of the box'.
customer_reviews.author: Ian P.

customer_reviews.title: POS...
customer_reviews.text: Wink is dead and their servers are only online 30% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Laughable product.  Wish I could give it zero stars
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. I received this and the setup page told me I had to return it to the factory to be upgraded by wink themselves. Laughable product. Buy the smartthings hub instead. That one just works..
customer_reviews.author: Jacques

customer_reviews.title: The distributor of this item did not advertise it as Refurbished
customer_reviews.text: This item was not advertised as refurbished, when I set it up I noticed that there were two devices, not mine that were connected. After two weeks the item would not connect to internet. Wasted $75
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Walker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: Have had nothing but problems. Random off commands being sent. Never starting my lights at programmed times. Locking up. Thinking seriously about Smartthings instead.
customer_reviews.author: L. Langston

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all. Keep loosing connection to ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. Keep loosing connection to Wink cloud. Every control (even turn on or off the light) has to go through the cloud and back to the hub. It creates a lot of delay. I just keep it since it's free with the $15 GE light. Hopefully, it improves someday. I now have the VeraEdge. I wish if the Wink hub can act as a Zwave repeater for my VeraEdge to get more coverage.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ton

customer_reviews.title: ... it to link my home to make it a smart home.
customer_reviews.text: I will use it to link my home to make it a smart home.
customer_reviews.author: Marque

customer_reviews.title: Works For The Money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Tech support helped when I needed it. Works as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Art T.

customer_reviews.title: not sure if i would purchase again if i could ...
customer_reviews.text: not sure if i would purchase again if i could go back. works ok with front door lolck but sometimes take a looong time to open. just released a new update seems to be performing well
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Wink is a fantastic Home Automation Solution and continuously improving further...
customer_reviews.text: I love using the wink hub as an integrated way to control all my smart devices. The list of supported devices keeps growing as well which is great. The app allows you to control all your devices from one great interface from home or away. The ability to setup shortcuts so that you are one click away from different favourite setting is extremely convenient. Furthermore, you can configure "robots" that allow for automated actions based on triggers like your location or a sensor going off. This is great for convenience, security and peace of mind. I highly recommend it to everyone and you won't regret it as it keeps getting better.
customer_reviews.author: N. H.

customer_reviews.title: and I love it. In addition to all the devices I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the wink hub and multiple connected devices, and I love it. In addition to all the devices I have connected,thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use it with the Aeon Labs Micro Switch. Love how I can control my lights from iOS notification center.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: ... firmware but once I got it replaced all is good.
customer_reviews.text: The first one was shipped with the old firmware but once I got it replaced all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis London

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The wink system is very slow and not as reactive as other systems.
customer_reviews.author: R Mac

customer_reviews.title: Easy configuration
customer_reviews.text: Easy configuration and ready to use it. At the begining I had a little problem with my Sammsung Galaxy 5 but I only disabled the mobile and data service while I was configuring the hub.
customer_reviews.author: pedrot

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It cannot link to Zigbee device and some of z-wave device.
customer_reviews.author: Ultimaker

customer_reviews.title: works but poor support for Z-Wave sensor devices
customer_reviews.text: The hub works but the Z-Wave sensor I wanted to attach to it does not. Poor support for sensors like the Everspring Z-Wave Water/flood detector.
customer_reviews.author: D. Orecchio

customer_reviews.title: comparer to Revolv, it gives more features for the ...
customer_reviews.text: comparer to Revolv, it gives more features for the connected device such as a thermostat but it can not connect to Insteon devices. It takes to many attemps to connect to a device. It's ok
customer_reviews.author: antoine geffard

customer_reviews.title: I currently use it for control of one GE-Link Smart LED zigbee light bulb and an Aeon Labs zwave ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hub knowing that I wanted to remove its dependance on the internet for control. Rooting the hub worked very well for me but is not a novice task. It's the cheapest local network controllable hub I could find. I currently use it for control of one GE-Link Smart LED zigbee light bulb and an Aeon Labs zwave power line on/off switch with plans to add Aeon Labs Aeotec zwave sensors and a CT100 zwave thermostat. The bulb and switch work very well and response time is minimal. I suggest sticking to devices confirmed working for the hub as I had purchased a SmartThings Multi Sensor for my door that would not pair with this hub.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mundorff

customer_reviews.title: Used and abused
customer_reviews.text: Product was previously owned but not as advertised, pronounced yellow marks on the back indicating overheating and the reset button was broken. Product is useless and money is wasted.
customer_reviews.author: querry

customer_reviews.title: Hope the manufacture's engineers and amazon's engineers work could work ...
customer_reviews.text: Hope the manufacture's engineers and amazon's engineers work could work together to improve the product features and remove the issues. The stars posted just for current, in future must be more than current's one .
customer_reviews.author: lizhj

customer_reviews.title: A great beginning to home automation
customer_reviews.text: I've owned the Wink hub for over 5 months now. I purchased it with 2 GE controllable LED light bulbs. Since then I've added 2 more GE bulbs 2 Spotters and 1 Kittie Smoke/CO2 detector. In the beginning I was somewhat dissappointed with its performance and reliability. Over time they have made a lot of good changes to this product and the servers the service them. I find that it has become much more reliable and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Seawind

customer_reviews.title: Try it out and see for yourself how bad it actually is.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like Wink's hardware team is good at what they do (they've packed a bunch of radio's in box), meanwhile the software team lacks decent development. My hub has been sitting in the corner because it outright crashes on the daily and firmware blame the software. The Mobile app isn't very good either. It's an experience one needs to try out to realize how bad it actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Tinoooooooo bought this

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Wink Hub about a month ago. Connecting to the wifi was pretty straight forward. I connected my Yale Real Living Deadbolt lock via the generic Z-Wave connection which was a bit tricky but eventually I got it connected. I think the issue was that lock was originally connected to AT&T's Digital Life system and I couldn't get it to break that connection. I purchased a GE Bulb from Home Depot and was able to connect that in a matter of moments. My only gripe about Wink so far is that Robots on the app are hit and miss. Sometimes they work and sometimes they don't. Can't wait to get more products connected!
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Cords

customer_reviews.title: not so great for now
customer_reviews.text: Did not work correctly would not automate scenes. Called wink they advised they are aware of the problem and are working on it with no time frame for a fix. I returned it and purchased veralite works flawlessly but is only z wave where hub when working correctly will use multiple devices and technology.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: ARGH!
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the most annoying piece of technology I've ever bought. And certainly the only one i've given up on. The app allows you to do nothing in-case of an error, except start all over again. Couldn't even get this thing to show up on the app, the hub turned blue like it was connected but the app on my phone just continued to insult me by saying it was taking longer than usual because of my slow connection or a wrong SSID/password. I've returned it and ordered a SmartThings hub instead. $50 extra is worth a working system!
customer_reviews.author: Callum Starrs

customer_reviews.title: Worth the trouble to get it right.
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit of a trouble to get it right. The units from Amazon had to be sent in for a firmware update. Once that was done it works well. I have lights, door locks and thermostat all hooked up under one app. They all worked with different apps but this is much more handy. The biggest thing I like is as I purchases new stuff it will work with this hub.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P. Garvey

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised; however, the setup instructions were ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised; however, the setup instructions were confusing. To connect the hub to your network, all you need to do is plug the hub into an electrical outlet, go to your phone, select a device to connect (hub) and move through the app until it gets to the page where you have to enter your network password (your network name or SSID should be visible on the app). Enter the password and although it'll take a few minutes, the hub will connect to your home network. Then add the lights or whatever product you're trying to add using the app.
customer_reviews.author: RonW

customer_reviews.title: It's good for what it does
customer_reviews.text: Works with GE Link lights, though it's still going to lock you down to specific hardware. I really hate HA hubs, so it's good for what it does. I just wish things were more open and I could take my connected devices anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: -Doesn't officially support all z-wave products out there. -Slight ...
customer_reviews.text: -Doesn't officially support all z-wave products out there. -Slight hiccup when connecting Kwikset lock. +Customer service agents are very helpful local humans that speak english with a american dialect...
customer_reviews.author: j k

customer_reviews.title: I hope they improve the system with time - construction quality looks good
customer_reviews.text: I found the Wink system to be unreliable and they don't have enough affordable components to make it worthwhile at this point. I hope they improve the system with time - construction quality looks good
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Works Great + Getting Better
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy and relatively quick. Just follow the instruction on the videos, it couldn't be simpler. Any issues I did have were resolved by calling Wink support, they were friendly and informative. I also appreciate that Wink is constantly updating to improve the system for a better user experience. The bugs I did find at launch seem to be going away as they refine. Overall I am very pleased with the hub + app and have no regrets choosing Wink. I am egar to see what they come up with next.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Belanger

customer_reviews.title: I like my SmartThings better
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge fan. I like my SmartThings better. I purchased a light bulb and this hub and just did not enjoy the same experience I had setting up the SmartThings hub and lights. I was not a fan of the software as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect with z-wave unless approved
customer_reviews.text: PHENOMENAL CUSTOMER SERVICE........but the product needs to support native z-wave. I purchased it and had all the issues reviewers have spoke of. Not connecting and going through infinite combinations for it to connect but now that it's connected it'll connect with "approved" z-wave devices. Figured it would connect with z-wave devices period. It does not. I'm sure it will at some point, now is not the time. The device is beautiful and the fact that it's wireless is a plus but it's going back
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Works great once ou figure out how to use it
customer_reviews.text: Works great once ou figure out how to use it. Might be nice to have instructions, but all and all I think its great. I have most of my switches and lights and garage working great and has been for 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Russell

customer_reviews.title: This is a piece of junk. It took 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. It took 10 tries before it found my home network. Then I couldn't pair it with either of my Z-wave locks from Kwikset. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: J. Piechoski

customer_reviews.title: It worked well with the Lutron Casata switch. It ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked well with the Lutron Casata switch. It did not work with the Schlage Deadbolt. Support was helpful but had limited troubleshooting ability. Wink sent 2 new hubs but those could not be made to work at all. I replaced the Schlaged Deadbolt with a new one but Wink was not able to successfully control that one either. Maybe in six months, they will have the bugs worked out.
customer_reviews.author: BigAir565

customer_reviews.title: May need a little assistance setting up but pretty quick if you figure out what you're doing and ...
customer_reviews.text: May need a little assistance setting up but pretty quick if you figure out what you're doing and then works great! (so far)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Connected.
customer_reviews.text: I have my apartment hooked with various Wink products and this hub makes it happen with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Sucks and So Does the Product!
customer_reviews.text: Product far from being ready for market, customer service none existent via email or phone. Hangs on updates, looses connectivity to devices.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg Aspis

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it yet, wait for the next major firmware upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware-wise, this is probably the most advanced Smart Home hub on the market today. Unfortunately, this is where my positive impressions end. Wink hub currently works only with a handful of devices available on the market. The biggest disappointment is that it does not work with most even basic Z-Wave devices, like light switches, dimmers, motion sensors, door/window sensors, etc. Hopefully, this will be resolved in the future with a software upgrade, but for the time being if you already use Z-Wave and are hoping you'll be able to control your devices with Wink hub, you'll be very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Digidealer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time with this one.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time with this one. Got this and a GE link light, the wink hub connected to my network, but could never connect to the light. I sent an email to support, I got a reply, over 2 months later! And the best part, they didn't even answer my question or help me, they just apologized for being late. So I asked again for support, still haven't heard back. Like I said, skip this one, plenty of other home automation systems out there.
customer_reviews.author: Toblerone

customer_reviews.title: Up and running in 5 mins
customer_reviews.text: Got my wink hub + 2 ge connected lights today and it was very easy to set up I was up and running in 5 mins. The Robots + timer features are great.
customer_reviews.author: user XS

customer_reviews.title: the hub of woe
customer_reviews.text: j u n k. never worked. never heard back from support.
customer_reviews.author: Kovio Mx

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this for the 1-Day Shipping; it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Seller sent item with incorrect firmware. Called Wink support and they said the item would never connect to their cloud server as-is and would need repaired at their home office.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this product. I quickly learned that most of the time it doesn't work. Don't waste your money. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... can't get it to connet to my network complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I can't get it to connet to my network complete waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have the Android app working, but need PC software to managed hub & devices. (thermostat, locks...)
customer_reviews.author: Terry Fihaley

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time yet
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but the connection is quirky. It can only connects and work about 40% of the time. It refused to work whenever there are an update. This is a very stupid thing. The system should remain working until you decided to update the firmware or app. I don't like the fact that my system will shut down and inoperative whenever the developer wants to update it. Oh, it only work about 40% of the time anyway.
customer_reviews.author: hoang nguyen

customer_reviews.title: This thing Rocks for the price better yet if you order it with other z-Wave devices
customer_reviews.text: This thing Rocks for the price better yet if you order it with other z-Wave devices. Easy to set up and connect things to. I have the Propane Tank gauge, some light switches and the Schlage deadbolt and it works great!.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up in mins
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up in mins.. Bought a dimmer switch for the kitchen lights. And my outdoor light all work great. Looking forward to expanding.
customer_reviews.author: tom poole

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. love being able to turn loss on a I approach the door.
customer_reviews.author: Pharmer

customer_reviews.title: unstable controlling my Honeywell Thermostate
customer_reviews.text: unstable controlling my HoneyWell thermostat. Always sets Permanent hold on any temperature change, so you cant use the Honeywell internal schedule as a back up. If you use the Honeywell app it prevents the wink control from access.
customer_reviews.author: GGZ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, and does what it should. However, it would be nice if there was some type of web interface that you can login and configure to say turn off the SSID broadcast. Its always broadcasting its ID which I do not like.
customer_reviews.author: Jason101

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. I needed to call tech support and they were very nice. They need to consider adding more bands to the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Edward R. Susse

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money with this
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. This product is pretty bad and has no real support. Wait for other brands for the internet of things. I bought this item a year ago. They sold it to me, sent it to me, and now that I ask for support they tell me they won't support me because I live in Mexico. They SOLD it to me in Mexico. What ias this?
customer_reviews.author: Rafael de Pina Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, not sure why so many bad reviews. Although there isn't any printed instructions, the box clearly states to down load the Wink app on your smart phone, tablet or PC. Once the app is down loaded it will walk you through the firmware updates, and "linking" of the various products it supports. You may have to change your routers security settings (I didn't have to). Don't let the negative reviews miss lead you, follow the instructions and soon you will be enjoying the 21st century convenience that this product offers.
customer_reviews.author: James A Namiotko

customer_reviews.title: Returned it twice. Never worked.
customer_reviews.text: Returned twice. Could not get hub to connect to iOS devices or network. Hours of customer service troubleshooting resulted in them finally giving up and ignoring my requests. I was very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: josephryan7

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast installation
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the bad comments, maybe laziness people? W/E is a very good product. Just 5 minutes to install.
customer_reviews.author: Mudo

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Worked well for a while...like 3 months. Then just died one day. Now it's a $50 coaster.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: limited and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable connectivity. Only supports a small set of Z-Wave devices from their partners.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Flaky, difficult to set up, needs more work
customer_reviews.text: Flaky. The light bulbs flicker on and off every 30 minutes, the device sometimes to forget everything when the internet goes out or it's been unplugged for awhile...
customer_reviews.author: Carter

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time and money even if you get it for free.
customer_reviews.text: The product does not work. Tried getting through to customer service and was on-hold for over 30 minutes before hanging up. Sent email and had a few emails with 1st Level support and was told I would hear later that night from 2nd Level support. Two days later and two emails sent and still no response. Sending this back and getting my money back.
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: I am only using to control kwikset door lock. Its little slow but awesome. I still need to try Robots but it looks cool.
customer_reviews.author: Mehar Randhawa

customer_reviews.title: Generally what it is requiring is for you to dumb down and compromise your WiFi to allow it to ...
customer_reviews.text: For a modern, wireless home automation product you would think that it could at least handle up to date technology. But sadly no. The Wink Hub makes use of your home WiFi only, without the option to plug into your router. However it can ONLY make use of outdated standards. It can not and will not connect to 5GHz systems and requires you to disable security cloaking. Generally what it is requiring is for you to dumb down and compromise your WiFi to allow it to function. The software and functionality is good once connected, but I'm dumping it so as not to compromise function and security of my wifeless network.
customer_reviews.author: JohnK

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but set up can be a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but set up can be a bit strange. Not mentioned in the instructions are the fact that a shorter SSID would be helpful when it comes to reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Sam H.

customer_reviews.title: i was disappointed. the product sits in its box
customer_reviews.text: i was disappointed. the product sits in its box. coukld not use it with my desktop. could not use it with my older iphone.a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: very limited Z-Wave support, they are forcing you to buy the products they produce. buy a smarttings instead.. i know i am.
customer_reviews.author: skylab

customer_reviews.title: Get a system like VERA ( former Mi Casa Verde) which has full ...
customer_reviews.text: WINK does NOT work unless you are connected to internet through the wired/FiOS hard connection. You loose any control over your home if the internet is out. This creates dangerous and unsafe condition. I am surprise that manufacturers and promoting stores are willing to accept any such liability. Go get a system like VERA ( former Mi Casa Verde) which has full control over local network (WiFi or wired) and through Internet (any which way connected). Very disappointed. The WINK a all alike from Lowes, Staples, etc should be considered dangerous and in the future trivial to monetize, i.e. to make you pay to control your own stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Just a customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It states that it will connect to most devices, it won't.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was obliged to buy a second one...The first HUB was zero.
customer_reviews.author: Clément Vezina

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for Upgrades
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with z-wave and basic hue functionality. Wish it worked with my Hunter Doulas blinds... Hopeful it will in future updates. Also Hue bulbs although compatible can't be used in an automated light recipe - hoping this will also be addressed in future updates.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Williams

customer_reviews.title: Relies on external servers to function. Horrible idea.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work when the Wink servers are not functioning. As of today, 8/26/2014, they have been down for nearly one day and the whole thing fell apart. This hub relies on external servers to operate, which makes it a very bad choice for any application related to home security. Just imagine their servers getting hacked - and your front door locks are readily unlocked for burglars arriving at your address also picked up from the Wink servers. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: does not work must need really fast internet only buy if u have 20 plus megabits
customer_reviews.author: KennyGlascow

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on wink.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this! the initial connection was elate ell easy, but after I changed my wifi router, it will NOT connect. Wink customer support is worthless and can't/won't answer emails. Even the automated response to my initial request for help took 3 days!! I will be returning this waste of a resource.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Connor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best customer support team, best help from Dylan, a little problem at first but now everything running smooth.Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: dung d duong

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment. It just does not work
customer_reviews.text: . I loved the idea and really wanted this to work but it just would not connect with the kwikset lock I brought along with the hub. Despite several calls to a very friendly customer support crew and multiple different attempts to pair devices to the hub it still does not work. In my last call with customer support they thought it was a time stamp issue on their server and they would investigate and call me back. That was 4 days ago and nothing. Do not waste your time on this until they figure out how to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: G. Egerton

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: System great for simple lighting control but not impressed with "scene" programming and support - returned for Vera Lite.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Crap. Hard to connect. Unlock's and lock's door all the time for nothing. After a week don't connect at all anymore. Don't buy

customer_reviews.text: very specific products needed for this.... gonna collect dust for a bit... I should have listened to the reviews
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: $50 paperweight
customer_reviews.text: This hub is the Google Plus of home automation hubs. That is to say that it's a great idea at the right time but they botched the roll-out so hard that it might kill the product. The hub can't connect to some server somewhere. I'm fairly tech-savvy and usually an early adopter; but after spending about 2 hours with this product, I couldn't get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymouse

product_meta.title: Wink Hub, PWHUB-WH01, by Wink, Z-Wave Certification: ZC10-14080002
product_meta.description: The Wink HUB allows your diverse collection of smart products to speak the same wireless language so you can easily control them-and customize their interactions-from the Wink App. The Wink app is a beautifully designed mobile app that keeps you connected to your home-no matter where you are. Available free on the App Store and Google Play. Products that are Wink App Ready have Wink technology built in and can connect directly to the Wink app without the assistance of the Wink HUB. Wink App Compatible products require the Wink HUB to connect to the Wink app. The Wink HUB allows them to speak the same wireless language, so you can easily control them- and customize their interactions-all from the Wink app. Make buttons to quickly control anything. No monthly fees or contracts, EVER. Get help from a human anytime. 1. Download the Wink app and connect your HUB. Wink app available on the App Store or Google Play. Wink HUB connects in minutes. Blinds, lights, locks, and more, from anywhere in the world!
feature_bullets: The Wink app is free to use and can be downloaded through the Apple App Store or Google Play. All you need is an email account, and there are no long-term contracts or service fees. The Wink app connects you to products that already have Wink technology built in.

The Wink HUB expands your centralized control by speaking many of the wireless languages that various products already use and connects them through the Wink app, providing a single organized platform from which you can operate your smart home.
Easy setup means you'll spend more time enjoying your products and less time installing them.

The Wink HUB supports many of the products that use Wi-Fi, ZigBee, Z-Wave, and Lutron ClearConnect, enabling remote control via the Wink app on your smartphone. It can be run on Android mobile, Android Wear, and iOS.
For more a more detailed explanation on which devices we support and why, along with other FAQ, please see our PDF Guide in the Technical Specification section below.
